availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Julia Hawkins Cook in Christian County, Kentucky, on January 15, 1861. Father of Florence Cook and Viola Cook. Farmer in Farmersville, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Farmersville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Farmersville, p. 119.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Farmersville, p. 210A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Scates Mill, p. 555A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Christian County Marriages, 1857-1875, Film #000465564, p. 59.
"Reuben Cook (1830-1905)," Find A Grave, Memorial #62964545, accessed December 2, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/62964545.
